name: sayable

able to be said, because of not being offensive or embarrassing or because it can be expressed in words: In his writing, he is always trying to push the boundaries of what is sayable. I want to make these subjects sayable and hearable.
More examplesFewer examplesI have a much larger sense of what is sayable. Not everything that is knowable is also sayable.

the sayable
anything that can be said, especially because it is not offensive or embarrassing: There's a tension in her writing between the spoken and the unspoken, the sayable and the unsayable. Her poems are located at the very edge of the sayable.
More examplesFewer examplesHe makes a distinction between the sayable and the unsayable.
